abstract.text: A template that displays and manages a list of items.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use the list template to display a list of items, grouped into one or more sections. When the user selects an item, CarPlay invokes Siri or a custom handler that you provide, depending on the type of list item. If your list displays hierarchical data, use the handler to add templates to the navigation hierarchy.
To create a list template, call the
method and provide an array of
objects. At runtime, use
to determine the maximum number of sections your list can display. Use
to determine the maximum number of items across all sections that your list can display.
Each section contains an array of list items — objects that conform to either the
or the
protocol. CarPlay provides three concrete implementations of these protocols:
A generic, selectable list item.
A list item that displays a series of images.
A list item that represents a conversation or contact.

The depth of a hierarchical list in CarPlay depends on your app’s entitlements. Food-ordering apps must not exceed two levels. The framework restricts all other categories of apps to five levels. Also, some vehicles limit the number of items that the list displays. See
for more information.
To display the list, call your interface controller’s
method, passing in the list template to add it to your navigation hierarchy. Alternatively, add the template as a tab in your

content.text: Integrating Siri Into Your Template App

inlineContent.text: For audio and communication apps, CarPlay provides an
assistant cell
to let users interact with your app using Siri_._
To enable the assistant cell, your app must support specific Siri intents:
To play audio, audio apps must support
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/sirikit/inplaymediaintent
To make phone calls, communication apps must support
doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/sirikit/instartcallintent
To enable the assistant cell in your list template, use
and provide the required configuration. For more information, see
. CarPlay automatically updates your app’s interface if you change the template’s
property.

abstract.text: Integrate CarPlay in apps related to audio, communication, navigation, parking, EV charging, food ordering, and more.
An object that provides the configuration attributes for the assistant cell.
The methods that templates use to provide buttons for the navigation bar.
A template that displays and manages a grid of items.
Adds the specified template to the navigation hierarchy and displays it.
A list template row that displays a series of images.
A selectable row in a list template.
A container that groups your list items into sections.
A template that displays and manages a list of items.
The object that provides the configuration attributes for the assistant cell.
The object that serves as the delegate to the list template.
An array of subtitle variants for the template’s empty view.
An array of title variants for the template’s empty view.
Returns the index path for the specified item.
Creates a list template with an array of list sections and optional title.
Creates a sectioned list template that optionally displays the assistant cell.
The total number of items, across all sections, in the list.
The maximum number of items, across all sections, that the template can display.
The maximum number of sections that the template can display.
The number of sections in the list.
The sections that the list displays.
If YES, a spinning activity indicator will be displayed while the list template contains no items.
The activity indicator will be displayed in addition to any @c emptyViewTitleVariants or
The title that the navigation bar displays when the template is visible.
Adds, removes, reorders, or updates the list’s sections.
The interface an object implements to serve as the delegate for a list template.
A description of the common properties of all list item types.
A list template row that represents a conversation or contact.
A description of a selectable list item.
An object that provides vehicle properties and configuration for the CarPlay environment.
A container template that displays and manages other templates, presenting them as tabs.
An abstract base class for interface templates.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
